intro: Dicrastylis linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or brown. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats, often found in swampy areas or along waterways. Dicrastylis linearifolia is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
